maintainer.name: Gentoo network monitoring and analysis project

use.flag: Build the AFPacket data acquisition module. Functions similar to the PCAP module but with better performance. Snort can run unprivileged when using this module. AFpacket supports both inline and passive modes.
Build the BPF data acquisition module that implements filtering on packet reception when given a Berkeley Packet Filter (BPF) to operate with. BPF supports both inline and passive modes.
Build the Dump data acquisition module. The dump DAQ allows you to test the various inline mode features available in 2.9 Snort like injection and normalization.

Build the Flow State Table (FST) data acquisition module. FST module is a wrapper module that mimics operating on top of a flow- tracking dataplane. It will perform basic decoding of packet messages received from the lower modules in the stack and use that information to classify packets into flows and track state for those flows.
Build the IPQ data acquisition module. IPQ is the old way to process iptables packets for inline deployments. Snort can not run unprivileged when using this module.
Build the Gateway Load Balancer (GWLB) data acquisition module. GWLB is used to deploy, scale and manage third-party virtual appliances in a public cloud environment.
Build the NFQ data acquisition module. NFQ is the new way to process iptables packets for inline deployments. Snort can not run unprivileged when using this module.
Build the PCAP data acquisition module.
Build the savefile data acquisition module designed for performance-optimized readback of traditional pcap savefiles.
Build the trace data acquisition module that records information about packet message verdicts, injected packet messages, and IOCTL calls that it intercepts to a text file.
